description: On April 2nd 2020, The Ministry of Health in Palau issues a press release urging the public to get factual information on Covid-19 from trusted sources, promoting the usage of the the MOH Hotline, bringing to attention the “widespread creation, publication and sharing on social media of false, fraudulent and unsubstantiated content about claims of vaccines and cures for Covid-19 across the internet”. Trusted sources cited are as follows: The Palau Ministry of Health, US Center for Disease Control and Prevention, World Health Organization.

description: Palau Ministry of Healh issued a Certification of an Unavoidable Public Health Emergency for COVID-19 on Mar. 17, 2020.
As of May 11th Public Health Emergency Operations Plan remains activated, Even with zero reported cases in Palau, Certification of Covid-19 as an unavoidable public health emergency is maintained.
The Government of Palau initiated health screening on Jan. 23, 2020 at Palau International Airport and Malakal seaport to screen all visitors to Palau.

The Government of Palau declares that any person, including a crew member, a Palauan citizen, or a Palau resident, arriving into Palau at any point of entry is required to complete a health declaration form.
The Government of Palau strongly recommends all persons to postpone their travel plan to Mainland China, Hong Kong, Macau, or other affected countries.

description: The Government of Palau implements the restriction of entry of cruise ships into any Palau port from March 1 to 31, 2020. No cruise ship shall be allowed to enter unless the captain submits satisfactory proof that the vessel has not called in Mainland China, Hong Kong, and Macau, and that none of its passengers originated from or transited through those destinations within 14 days of boarding the vessel.

description: Effective March 18th, 2020, Palau's presidential directive states no Executive branch employee will travel internationally between March 18 and April 30th. Exemptions can be made pending approval from the responsible minister of an executive employee, or from the director if from an independent agency.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: April 29th, 2020, the President of Palau passes Executive Order NO. 440 which established flight suspensions from Hong Kong, Macau, and Mainland China until June 30th as well as not allowing travelers with travel originating from or transiting through Mainland China, Hong Kong, or Macau through June 30th, 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: The Palau ""The Department of Public Health and Social Services held testing on Monday (June 8th) for Palauan citizens"" returning from Taiwan and Guam via government chartered planes. The citizen travelers will undergo a second test before departing and a third and fourth test once back in Palau.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: Maintaining screening control policy- On July 23rd 2020, Malakal International Seaport in Palau screened 2 incoming ship vessels-  primarily screening 142 travelers and performing a secondary screening on 122 of those travelers.
The Palauan Ministry of Health accesses the Hospital Trust Fund and other authorized funding sources for COVID-19 prevention, preparation, screening, containment, mitigation, and treatment efforts.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: All Palauan ministries, agencies, and civil service partners are called to focus their efforts to prevent the entry of COVID-19 into the Republic. All government manpower and resources shall be prioritized to implement prevention, preparation, screening, containment, mitigation, and treatment efforts led by the Ministry of Health and National Emergency Committee. The Ministry of Health or National Emergency may request the assistance of any government employee; any requested employee shall be transferred or temporarily assigned, as appropriate, to provide the requested assistance.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The Government of Palau suspends all Ministry of Health personnel the right to travel overseas.

On April 8th in Palau, the Ministry of Health declared they will identify appropriate and adequate quarantine facilities to be used following return from international travel or in the case of suspected exposure but unconfirmed covid-19  test.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On April 8th in Palau, the ministry of health declared (in the scenario of a positive test result)  alternate care sites at Kalau gym in Meyuns, Koror as the primary isolation site for non-critical infected persons and Belau National Hospital isolation rooms as the primary isolation site for infected persons in need of critical care.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: In Palau, ""the government has delved into reserves to beef up the services, building in less than a week quarantine facilities, an isolation unit and a virus laboratory that completed its first 31 locally-administered tests on Tuesday April 14th"", and additionally the government ""bought test kits, ventilators and modern lab equipment from Taiwan with funding from the United States""
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs

description: “The Bureau of Public Services in Palau shall establish a Covid-19 stipend as additional compensation for frontline workers engaged in activities which present an increased risk of exposure to Covid-19.” The stipend is available only to frontline workers for time spent in activities that actually risk exposure to Covid-19. The stipend takes effect immediately and remains available until this order is amended or rescinded.
Since implementing testing procedures on April 14th 2020, As of July 14th 2020, Palau has conducted 877 Covid-19 tests all reporting negative results.

Health Testing began in the nation of Palau on Tuesday April 14th thanks to test kits among health resources acquired from Taiwan with US funding. Tests are ongoing and allocated to ""priority groups: persons meeting Covid-19 case definition, symptomatic patients, first responders and front line workers, quarantined inbound travelers.""
As of July 23rd 2020, Palau has successfully conducted 1,047 covid-19 tests, all 1,047 tests resulting in negative.

In Palau “the public is urged not to panic and to continue practicing public health measures to prevent respiratory infection”, including hand hygiene, respiratory etiquette, avoiding close contact with those who are sick, and cleaning/disinfecting frequently touched surfaces. March 17th 2020 - ongoing.

In Palau, Ministry of Health Directive No. 114-120 issued on May 11th 2020  declared parks, gyms and recreational areas may resume regular operations with proper hand hygiene, respiratory etiquette and regular cleaning and disinfecting of frequently touched objects and surfaces
The Kayangel State Government temporarily suspends all boats or any other transportation to and from Kayangel until April 30th, 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: Announced April 3rd, 2020, the state of Kayangel in Palau announced that all boats or any transportation to and from Kayangel will be suspended until April 30th. However, the Kayangel state boat will be permitted to transport supplies only.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: Government of Palau activates the Ministry of Health Public Health Emergency Operations Plan.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: On March 20th 2020, An executive order from the president of Palau established ""a joint leadership working group to develop and and recommend measures to mitigate the social and economic impacts of the Covid-19 pandemic."" Meetings by this group occur weekly and aim to look beyond emergency response measures- focusing on long term concerns by assessing the health, safety, social and economic impacts of the covid-19 pandemic, making recommendations to support, relieve and ensure… this group is active until disbanded.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: Effective April 22nd, 2020, the Palau government passed HB 10-131-14S, SD2 the COVID-19 Presidential Borrowing Act of 2020. The Act authorizes president Tommy E. Remengesau to borrow 60 million dollars from any financial institution(s) or foreign government(s) in order to stave off economic decline for the fiscal year of 2020, 2021, and the potential future. It is stated the money is to be used to keep current social programs running while specifically saving the borrowed funds for the next administration.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: Announced on April 24th, approved and effective April 27th, Palau passed the Coronavirus Relief One Stop Shop Act or ""CROSS Act"", which gives a breakdown of funds to be used to aid the private sector from the National Treasury for general operations, capital investments, and private sector relief measures.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: Palau Ministry of Health 24-hour hotline has been activated for public inquiries (488-0555).
type_text: Palau Ministry of Health 24-hour hotline has been activated for public inquiries (488-0555).

description: The Government of Palau recommends anyone who is 55 or older and/or in high-risk populations to reschedule any non-essential appointments and visits and avoid the Belau National Hospital unless they are seeking urgent medical care.
type_text: The Government of Palau recommends anyone who is 55 or older and/or in high-risk populations to reschedule any non-essential appointments and visits and avoid the Belau National Hospital unless they are seeking urgent medical care.

description: Announced and effective on March 18th, 2020, the Republic of Palau's Beaurau of Public Saftey which operates under the Ministry of Justice, suspends all visitation to the Division of Corrections as a precautionary measure to protect the health of inmates and police officers and as an effort to prevent the potential spread of COVID19 until further notice.
type_text: The policy suspends all visitation to the Division of Corrections by the Ministry of Justice.

description: On April 24th 2020, the Palau National Government passed “RPPL No. 10-56: The Coronavirus Relief One Stop Shop” Act, authorizing “temporary private sector relief measures for mitigation of the social impacts related to Covid-19, to authorize and appropriate additional sums from the national treasury for general operations, capital improvements and private sector relief measures for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2020, and for other related purposes.”
type_text: Passing an official Act through Palau's national government (proposed by the president and approved by the house, and senate); borrowing and reallocating funds to mitigate damage caused by Covid-19.

description: Palau’s Ministry of Health activates the 24 hour Covid-19 Hotline for public inquiries and in an attempt to relay “credible and timely information to stakeholders and relevant information to the public and will continue to provide updates as they become available”.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: The Government of Palau encourages the general public to exercise self-care and self-quarantine if they are sick
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Issued April 8th, the Ministry of Health in Koror, Palau, authorized the isolation and quarantine measures to control the Coronavirus Disease 2019. Any person who is suspected of being exposed is expected to go into quarantine for the mandatory 14 days. Additionally, any persons coming from Guam, China, Japan, Korea, or the Philippines will be considered to have been exposed and be quarantined for the 14 days.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: In Palau, Citizen travelers from Guam and Taiwan upon re-entry to Palau will undergo another 14 days of quarantine and be tested twice more, and ""if they pass these third and fourth tests, they will be released and be required to home quarantine for an additional 14 days"".
In Palau, “MOH issued Directive No. 170-20 on July 7, 2020 re-authorizing isolation and quarantine measures for COVID-19”

As of July 31st 2020, The Ministry of Health's Situation Update reports  203 individuals in official quarantine facilities, while maintaining  encouragement of hand hygiene, respiratory etiquette, frequent disinfection and cleaning of objects.

In Palau, Ministry of Health Directive No. 114-120 issued on May 11th 2020, authorized the The Belau National hospital (BNH) emergency operations plan remain activated while the BNH regulations shift as follows: ""chronic disease clinics and elective surgeries may resume, Maintain physical distancing in clinic and healthcare settings, in-patient visiting hours reduced to 1 hour a day, admitted patients allowed 1 caretaker at a time, Clinic hours to be staggered with regular cleaning and disinfecting to be maintained, persons age 55+ or anyone with underlying medical conditions are recommended to avoid visiting the BNH unless seeking critical medical care, Maintain health screening, surveillance and monitoring at all BNH ports of entry"".

In Palau, Ministry of Health Directive No. 114-120 issued on May 11th 2020 enforced the following general restriction for the opening of businesses, worksites and restaurants: “ Resume regular operating hours, Engage in Virtual meetings whenever possible, Maintain engineering and environmental controls including barriers, regular cleaning and disinfecting, Monitoring employees and patrons, forbidding entry of sick people, Encourage staying home when sick and providing sick leave to compliant employees, Use your own pen and stationary, Maintain proper food safety practices, Encourage employees and patrons to practice proper hand hygiene and respiratory etiquette”
The Government of Palau limits Belau National Hospital in-patient visiting hours to one hour per day.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

description: Palau is offering a compressed work schedule that ""shall be voluntary, and shall allow employees to work 40 hours per week on a schedule other than the basic workweek"" for any office of the executive branch of the national government between July 1st 2020 to December 31st 2020. allowing ""the republic of Palau to continue to grow healthier as a nation and develop its overall social and cultural structure... to engage in other activities aimed at bettering the employees physical and/or mental health during the Covid-19 pandemic"". Compressing work schedules will not only “motivate employees to be more satisfied, focused and efficient” but will also “realize savings in fuel and vehicle maintenance costs for those offices that provide employees with transportation free transportation... as well as savings in utility costs when offices are closed a day more than usual”
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Palau is offering a compressed work schedule that ""shall be voluntary, and shall allow employees to work 40 hours per week on a schedule other than the basic workweek"" for any office of the executive branch of the national government between July 1st 2020 to December 31st 2020. allowing ""the republic of Palau to continue to grow healthier as a nation and develop its overall social and cultural structure... to engage in other activities aimed at bettering the employees physical and/or mental health during the Covid-19 pandemic"". Compressing work schedules will not only “motivate employees to be more satisfied, focused and efficient” but will also “realize savings in fuel and vehicle maintenance costs for those offices that provide employees with transportation free transportation... as well as savings in utility costs when offices are closed a day more than usual”
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)

description: Effective April 6th, 2020, the Ministry of Health in Palau issued the recommendation of wearing cloth face coverings/Masks, especially in Areas of Significant (COVID-19) Community-Based Transmission. Additionally specified not to use surgical or N-95 respirators as those are deemed critical supplies for healthcare workers.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart

description: Effective April 6th, 2020, the Ministry of Health in Palau issued the recommendation of wearing cloth face coverings/Masks, especially in Areas of Significant (COVID-19) Community-Based Transmission. Additionally specified not to use surgical or N-95 respirators as those are deemed critical supplies for healthcare workers.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere

description: On April 6th 2020, The Palau Ministry of Health recommends the ""Use of Cloth Face Coverings/Masks, Especially in Areas of Significant (COVID-19) Community-Based Transmission"", noting that ""Cloth face coverings/masks are not a substitute for social distancing. It is still very important to maintain 6-feet social distancing to slow the spread of the virus
